result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael R McQuillan in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael R McQuillan is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R McQuillan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael R McQuillan in court, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Riniker swears to the complaint. Court explains complaint, extradition rights, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State heard and requests no bond per request from Colorado. Court heard and sets no bond per request from Colorado. Defendant heard. Extradition hearing set. 3:10pm- back on record. Attorney Riniker received a letter from Colorado stating they will not extradite and moves to dismiss case. Court heard and dismisses case.
